raw_answer:
Based on the information in Table 2 ("Clinical features of patients with p.D620N mutation") and the accompanying text:

Patient CII-3 from Family C had an age of disease onset of 34 years and a disease duration of 7 years at the time of the study.
His clinical features included:
*   Resting tremor: Yes (+)
*   Bradykinesia: Yes (+)
*   Rigidity: Yes (+)
*   Gait disturbance: Yes (+)
*   Postural instability: Yes (+)
*   Clinical response to levodopa: Yes (+)
*   Wearing off: Yes (+)
*   Asymmetry at onset: Yes (+)
*   Orthostatic hypotension: No (-)
*   Incontinence: No (-)
*   Urinary urgency: No (-)
*   Levodopa-induced dyskinesia: Yes (+)
*   Sleep benefit: Yes (+)
*   Dystonia at onset: No (-)
*   Hyperreflexia: No (-)
*   Hallucination: No (-)
*   Other psychosis: No (-)
*   Dementia: No (-)
*   Gaze palsy: No (-)
*   Brain MRI: Within normal limits (WNL)
*   Cardiac MIBG scintigraphy: Not performed

The text on page 3 states: "Patients BIII-8 and CII-3 both developed upper limb rest tremor at ages 34 and 55, respectively." This confirms the initial symptom and age of onset for CII-3. Figure 1C indicates patient CII-3 is an affected male with the p.D620N mutation, and his father (I-1) also developed PD.
question: Regarding patient 'CII-3' from family 'Family C': What is the clinical status of the patient?
